skillTree.localised_description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter attacks.

Some Wood Elf warriors are adorned with all manner of tattoos and warpaint that grant them the blessing of their gods. Such Talismanic Tattoos can ward against all manner of attacks, sometimes even those utilising magic.
Eldrazor is the patron of duellists and of those who yearn to fight battles - at least if the combatant fights for a just cause, rather than out of mindless barbarism.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Wychwethyl knows an ancient and secret war dance which he uses in battle with deadly efficiency.
All who have seen Wychwethyl the Wild in battle and lived to tell about it have praised his savagery in melee.

effects.description: Attacks cause "Killing Blow" effect (chance to kill humanoid/cavalry target on hit)

skillTree.localised_description: All of Wychwethyl's Wardancers are sublime warriors, made even more deadly through their ancient war dances. For these, the favoured rituals of the Trickster God, no rhythm is called nor are orders issued. Instead, the dancers instinctively enact a pattern of lethal movements, complementing the dances performed by the rest of the troupe.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Wychwethyl leaps and pirouettes through the enemy ranks to music only he hears, gracefully evading his opponent’s clumsy blows and ending his life with an impossibly swift to strike of his own.
There are paths and secret ways located in Athel Loren that only Wychwethyl and his kin know about.

effects.description: Evasion chance when using the Worldroots: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: "Take your swords, put your helmets on and may Loec guide you, for we march to war!"
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
So much of war is an art. Over time and with much practice, combat moves can resemble a series of perfectly-rehearsed dance moves.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

skillTree.localised_description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

skillTree.localised_description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

skillTree.localised_description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

skillTree.localised_description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

skillTree.localised_description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

factionEffects.localised_description: Wychwethyl the Wild has been tasked to restore the Forest of Gloom or as the locals call it, Vale of Webs, to it's former glory by Ariel, the Queen of Athel Loren. A task well suited for one of Loec's kin and his merry crew of dancers.

effects.description: All Shadow Dances of Loec abilities available to Wardancer and Bladesinger units
Weapon strength: +10% for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
Upkeep: -15% for Wardancer and Bladesinger units

items.colour_text: Wychwethyl carries the Drum of Orcskin which is made from the stretched skin of an Orc warlord slain at the battle of the Glade of Woe and beaten with a drumstick made from his rib-bone.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: Stardust Globes are crystal orbs filled with trickster's special concoctions that will make anyone caught in their way an easy prey for Wychwethyl and his followers.

ui_effects.localised_text: Applies Disrupted! effect on contact, reducing accuracy and melee prowess

items.colour_text: One sword strikes to forge a new beginning. The other falls to end an era. Together, they bring about the cycle of rebirth that sustains the ailing Weave.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Greenskins

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Wychwethyl the Wild is a Wardancer of exceptional skill and agility. It is he who performs the ritual dance at the beginning of spring which awakens the King and Queen in the Wood after their long sleep in the Oak of Ages.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for Wardancer and Bladesinger units
	(Lord's army)
